verses.verse: Then Job <S%H347><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%>
I have heard <S%H8085><s%> many <S%H7227><s%> such <S%H428><s%> things: miserable <S%H5999><s%> comforters <S%H5162><s%> are you all. <S%H3605><s%>
Shall vain <S%H7307><s%> words <S%H1697><s%> have an end? <S%H7093><s%> or <S%H176><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> emboldens <S%H4834><s%> you that you answer? <S%H6030><s%>

I also <S%H1571><s%> could speak <S%H1696><s%> as you do: if <S%H3863><s%> your soul <S%H5315><s%> were in my soul's <S%H5315><s%> stead, <S%H8478><s%> I could heap <S%H2266><s%> up words <S%H4405><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> you, and shake <S%H5128><s%> my head <S%H7218><s%> at you.
But I would strengthen <S%H553><s%> you with my mouth, <S%H6310><s%> and the moving <S%H5205><s%> of my lips <S%H8193><s%> should assuage <S%H2820><s%> your grief.
Though <S%H518><s%> I speak, <S%H1696><s%> my grief <S%H3511><s%> is not assuaged: <S%H2820><s%> and though I forbear, <S%H2308><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> am I eased? <S%H1980><s%>
But now <S%H6258><s%> he has made me weary: <S%H3811><s%> you have made desolate <S%H8074><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> my company. <S%H5712><s%>

And you have filled <S%H7059><s%> me with wrinkles, <S%H7059><s%> which is a witness <S%H5707><s%> against me: and my leanness <S%H3585><s%> rising <S%H6965><s%> up in me bears <S%H6030><s%> witness <S%H6030><s%> to my face. <S%H6440><s%>

He tears <S%H2963><s%> me in his wrath, <S%H639><s%> who hates <S%H7852><s%> me: he gnashes <S%H2786><s%> on me with his teeth; <S%H8127><s%> my enemy <S%H6862><s%> sharpens <S%H3913><s%> his eyes <S%H5869><s%> on me.

They have gaped <S%H6473><s%> on me with their mouth; <S%H6310><s%> they have smitten <S%H5221><s%> me on the cheek <S%H3895><s%> reproachfully; <S%H2781><s%> they have gathered <S%H4390><s%> themselves together <S%H3162><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> me.
God <S%H410><s%> has delivered <S%H5462><s%> me to the ungodly, <S%H5760><s%> and turned <S%H3399><s%> me over <S%H5921><s%> into <S%H413><s%> the hands <S%H3027><s%> of the wicked. <S%H7563><s%>

I was at ease, <S%H7961><s%> but he has broken <S%H6565><s%> me asunder: he has also taken <S%H247><s%> me by my neck, <S%H6203><s%> and shaken <S%H6327><s%> me to pieces, and set <S%H6965><s%> me up for his mark. <S%H4307><s%>

His archers <S%H7228><s%> compass <S%H5437><s%> me round <S%H5437><s%> about, he splits <S%H6398><s%> my reins <S%H3629><s%> asunder, and does not spare; <S%H2550><s%> he pours <S%H8210><s%> out my gall <S%H4845><s%> on the ground. <S%H776><s%>
He breaks <S%H6555><s%> me with breach <S%H6556><s%> on breach, <S%H6556><s%> he runs <S%H7323><s%> on me like a giant. <S%H1368><s%>
I have sewed <S%H8609><s%> sackcloth <S%H8242><s%> on my skin, <S%H1539><s%> and defiled <S%H5953><s%> my horn <S%H7161><s%> in the dust. <S%H6083><s%>
My face <S%H6440><s%> is foul <S%H2560><s%> with weeping, <S%H1065><s%> and on <S%H5921><s%> my eyelids <S%H6079><s%> is the shadow <S%H6757><s%> of death; <S%H6757><s%>
Not for any injustice <S%H2555><s%> in my hands: <S%H3709><s%> also my prayer <S%H8605><s%> is pure. <S%H2134><s%>
O earth, <S%H776><s%> cover <S%H3680><s%> not you my blood, <S%H1818><s%> and let my cry <S%H2201><s%> have <S%H1961><s%> no <S%H408><s%> place. <S%H4725><s%>
Also <S%H1571><s%> now, <S%H6258><s%> behold, <S%H2009><s%> my witness <S%H5707><s%> is in heaven, <S%H8064><s%> and my record <S%H7717><s%> is on high. <S%H4791><s%>
My friends <S%H7453><s%> scorn <S%H3887><s%> me: but my eye <S%H5869><s%> pours <S%H1811><s%> out tears to God. <S%H433><s%>
O that one might plead <S%H3198><s%> for a man <S%H1397><s%> with God, <S%H433><s%> as a man <S%H120><s%> pleads for his neighbor! <S%H7453><s%>
When <S%H3588><s%> a few <S%H4557><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> are come, <S%H857><s%> then I shall go <S%H1980><s%> the way <S%H734><s%> from where I shall not return. <S%H7725><s%>
